text: Very happy, Disneyesque MUSIC swirls in. PAN DOWN from a pretty blue sky, to a small quaint town nestled in the hills. A wooden sign tells us this is Sout Park.

Birds fly into the air, TOWNSPEOPLE smile to each other a they walk by. It is a scene reminiscent of, if not directly ripped off from, the opening number of 'Beauty and the Beast'. A little eight year old boy walks happily down the street is STAN MARSH, a noble looking boy with piercing blue eye and a strong chin. As he walks, he sings a happy song.

I'm going to the movies To see the brighter side of life! I'm going to the movie Everything's gonna be alright! Forget all my troubles Put my own life on hold Let a studio tell me how I should view the world Where everything works out I love it that way I'm going to the movies The movies today!

We still only see the boy from the back as he reaches in closet and pulls out an orange coat. The kid puts his coat on, then turns to camera and pulls hood shut, so that we never get a good look at his face.
